item.title: Why does migration from self-service to PaaS rock? #Design
item.dc:creator: Alex Doan
item.description: A few examples of why and how the managed service solution hits the self-hosted platform versions nowadays
item.content:encoded:
Company ${name}, a provider of secure smart metering solutions, initially managed its monitoring with a self-hosted ThingsBoard instance serving as a data processing and visualization layer. However, as the company expanded, the team faced challenges with respect to the infrastructure and services administration.

The problem

The product owner at Company ${name} at that time described key blockers that prevented their market expansion strategy execution. Among others:

  1. In-house DevOps resources hiring is expensive budget-wise
  2. Customer deadlines did not introduce room for waiting
  3. Focus on server-side issues instead of application development

“Anything requiring constant attention besides the product is a lost opportunity cost for us. We wanted to focus on our solutions rather than the way how to support dev-prod environment”

John doe, Product owner

To overcome these challenges, the reliability team has reached out to us to request the migration to the ThingsBoard Cloud Enterprise plan subscription. Articulating the above show-stoppers, the Company ${name} aimed to redirect its focus to strategic projects without being encumbered by the complexities of system maintenance and upgrades.

Company ${name}, a leading Telco/Mobile network provider during the RFP (request for proposal) period, changed the requirement from a self-service IoT Hub to a managed service proposal as previous experience ended up as less marginal. The goal was to enter the technical partnership instead of reinventing the wheel.

Magenta Telekom is a technology company whose SaaS platform helps business and governmental customers manage and optimize operations using an IoT tech stack. The company operates at an incredibly high scale in terms of its global telco infrastructure. Before moving to ThingsBoard Cloud, the Company hosted their own data provisioning solution, but that layer was difficult to scale, support, and, in the end, not always reliable.

“Developers and people at the company were just exasperated and annoyed with the unreliability of getting queries to complete or with missing metrics.”

Senior Director, Production Engineering at magenta telekom

The Company is using the ITSM system, and members of the SRE team knew ThingsBoard offers backend logging and monitoring through ThingsBoard Cloud services. After a successful POC and trial run, the customer launched the Business IoTHub powered by ThingsBoard. The shift resulted in win-win technical cooperation where the client has a ready-to-market product and implements their IoT expansion plus access to custom features development resources.

item.title: Reliable T&H monitoring with WhereView & ThingsBoard #Design
item.dc:creator: Alex Doan
item.description: Reliable and high-quality control of temperature and humidity with constant access to monitoring data is an important condition for the storage of thermosensitive drugs and raw materials for medicines. The ThingsBoard partner — Vypin together with our team has implemented a solution for a global pharmaceutical company. The IoT application has helped to optimize processes and costs.
item.content:encoded:
Reliable and high-quality control of temperature and humidity with constant access to monitoring data is an important condition for the storage of thermosensitive drugs and raw materials for medicines. The ThingsBoard partner — Vypin together with our team has implemented a solution for a global pharmaceutical company. The IoT application has helped to optimize processes and costs.

The problem

The FDA (The Food & Drug Administration) has strict requirements and recommendations for pharmaceutical manufacturers, in particular regarding storage conditions and the control system to comply with these conditions (more about regulation can be found here). The customer asked  Vypin to replace the current system. The previous one didn’t meet the FDA standards, which was the reason for the fines and the potential risk of drug or component damage.

The patient, as they say in the medical field, had specific complaints. First of all, data loss. Existing devices could go offline for various reasons (from network outages to power loss), but the transmission or recording of telemetry did not take place. But the client couldn’t find out about these or those losses, which was the second complaint. The current system does not provide a notification mechanism. In addition, monitoring data was not available remotely.

Round-the-clock rotation of operators to control the temperature and humidity in the warehouse indeed is not the best solution. Therefore, in the regular automatic reports related to the storage environment state there were gaps in the tables and graphs. The FDA fines for such violations.

Customer officer says

Solution

To solve the problem, the Vypin team proposed an integrated Vypin-Whereview system (powered by ThingsBoard). The company built a wireless network, installed sensors and gateways

If we mention one of the first problems (data loss), the new sensors now had a memory module and could record telemetry locally. When the gateway connection was lost, data loss (!) didn’t and doesn’t occur. When the online gateway returns, it picks up the accumulated telemetry and sends it to Whereview.

The application, built on TB, solved the rest of the customer’s problems. First of all, the client’s responsible employee gets access to the monitoring data at any time. Managers also received access.

To see the Dashboard with graphs and tables, it is enough just to open the corresponding tab in your own browser and log in.

It makes sense to highlight that based on the rule engine and device profiles, Vypin set up a notification system. In case of violations of the specified conditions (for example, exceeding the temperature thresholds), notifications are received by those who should be aware of this recorded violation. This allows you to respond instantly and even take preventive measures.

Result

Everyone understands that it is better (easier, cheaper, less time-consuming) to prevent a disease than to treat it. With the new warehouse monitoring system, the client (patient) has the opportunity for prevention.

item.title: Reliable T&H monitoring with WhereView (ThingsBoard)
item.dc:creator: Alex Doan
item.description: Reliable and high-quality control of temperature and humidity with constant access to monitoring data is an important condition for the storage of thermosensitive drugs and raw materials for medicines. The ThingsBoard partner — Vypin together with our team has implemented a solution for a global pharmaceutical company. The IoT application has helped to optimize processes and costs.
item.content:encoded:
Reliable and high-quality control of temperature and humidity with constant access to monitoring data is an important condition for the storage of thermosensitive drugs and raw materials for medicines. The ThingsBoard partner — Vypin together with our team has implemented a solution for a global pharmaceutical company. The IoT application has helped to optimize processes and costs.

Client:

PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANY

Initial request:

ACCESS TO THE MONITORING DATA 24/7; NOTIFICATIONS

Must-have requirements:

DATA LOSS IS INACCEPTABLE, CRITICAL

The problem

The FDA (The Food & Drug Administration) has strict requirements and recommendations for pharmaceutical manufacturers, in particular regarding storage conditions and the control system to comply with these conditions (more about regulation can be found here). The customer asked  Vypin to replace the current system. The previous one didn’t meet the FDA standards, which was the reason for the fines and the potential risk of drug or component damage.

The patient, as they say in the medical field, had specific complaints. First of all, data loss. Existing devices could go offline for various reasons (from network outages to power loss), but the transmission or recording of telemetry did not take place. But the client couldn’t find out about these or those losses, which was the second complaint. The current system does not provide a notification mechanism. In addition, monitoring data was not available remotely.

Round-the-clock rotation of operators to control the temperature and humidity in the warehouse indeed is not the best solution. Therefore, in the regular automatic reports related to the storage environment state there were gaps in the tables and graphs. The FDA fines for such violations.

Customer complaint

Solution

To solve the problem, the Vypin team proposed an integrated Vypin-Whereview system (powered by ThingsBoard). The company built a wireless network, installed sensors and gateways

If we mention one of the first problems (data loss), the new sensors now had a memory module and could record telemetry locally. When the gateway connection was lost, data loss (!) didn’t and doesn’t occur. When the online gateway returns, it picks up the accumulated telemetry and sends it to Whereview.

In case of violations of the specified conditions (for example, exceeding the temperature thresholds), notifications are received by those who should be aware of this recorded violation. This allows you to respond instantly and even take preventive measures.

Everyone understands that it is better (easier, cheaper, less time-consuming) to prevent a disease than to treat it. With the new warehouse monitoring system, the client (patient) has the opportunity for prevention.
